Topic.Title: Our company just announced much higher health care costs next year.

Most health insurance companies that handle Medicare don't overcharge because they know the AARP is watching them closely. Humana is a possible exception as they have a bad reputation for ripping seniors off. Most everyone knows that the Koch brothers have financed a humongous antiObamacare campaign based on spreading lies. The one that was started by the Mimic ilovepelosi is one of those lies. If you would stop and think for a moment you would realize that if a Fortune 500 company raised the premium on their medical benefits by 50% it would be in the national news. So it is obviously a lie. Please use your brain and stop defending liars.

They also told any employee that smoked that they had to pay $1,800 more for healthcare next year. These are bona fide facts. Not making it up. Our employees are #$%$ OFF. No joke.

Message.Title: Two very large, dishonest derivative players will bring down the world financial markets.
Message.Msg: Look at the tell signs on both the NASDAQ/NYSE. What is happening is stagnation in the major indices. This happens when the large derivative players are shifting their positions. They are now moving money and are going to bet against both markets. In the past this is when large corrections take place (over 10 percent). The large derivative players are the ones that run the indices. For example look at Warren Buffet; he is a heavy derivative player that has, over the last five years, substantially decreased his position in stocks and gone the derivative route. Smart, rich player. Derivative are an easy way to hide money.......so large losses can be covered up. The SEC does not understand this and they cannot track this. The result is no regulation. It will only take one major, dishonest derivative player to send our financial systems into ruin.

Topic.Title: from nytimes, dust to dust, ROFLMFO, "Pension trustees said it must be a trick."

Message.Msg: Never mind human remains festering for days in the Nevada heat; what about that pony express platter I promised to the Bundy-Dube conventioneers? I can't bear the thought of starving intellectuals reduced to free-grazing at circus-circus buffets. Meanwhile, the 'Igloo In Bolivia Or Bust' mission faces a new threat from an unexpected source: Native Americans and their hippie lifestyle. Yesterday's visit to former aerospace colleagues went well; a company van showed up at the reservation, shuttled me in and out of Seattle (a little over two hours each way), and returned me to the beech bearing a small, specialized load of custom avionics. The threat comes from the Yakama Indians, whose reservation is a fine slice of heaven on earth. Last night I had a long talk and smoke with one of their elders, a tribal medicine man. He showed me maps of the reservation, and the names of the villages and lakes all spoke to me in voices at once foreign yet familiar: Trout Lake, Fish Lake, White Salmon, Goat Rocks, and most powerfully of all, Willy #$%$ Crossing. When I mentioned this to the medicine man, he asked what led me and my great black raven to his land, and I spoke in broad terms of my mission and the Igloo. He pulled on his pipe, and then asked what that man's alleged offense was. "Truth teller" I told him, and he nodded. "FishToKill, why do you deny your true self? You were placed here by the Creator to fish. Do you think it was chance that brought you and your aeroplane here to Lost Horse Plateau? Stay a while; rest, renew your strength. Catch fish, gather berries, eat them, and consider these words from a great leader who now dwells with the Great Spirit." "My strength is from the fish; my blood is from the fish, from the roots and berries. The fish and game are the essence of my life. I was not brought here from a foreign country; I did not come here at all. I was placed here by the Creator." -Chief Weninock, Yakama, 1915 I do need some rest....

Topic.Title: Our company just announced much higher health care costs next year.

Message.Msg: The requirement and expense to include employee children up to 26 years of age was spread over all employees of all companies. Also, it is mainly for children who remain in college as undergraduates (until 21 for undergraduates or graduate school until 26) where the college does not include medical insurance. If a child is not in college but has a job they most likely have their own medical insurance and are no longer included in your plan. That means the percentage of 26 year olds effecting your insurance premiums is a very small percentage. It also was implemented in 2012. What that means is that the costs increase for your next year is not a new cost. Your facts are all jumbled up as if you were deliberately trying to deceive people. Want to start all over again and tell us what are the facts by telling us what company you work for and what your costs are for this year and the projected costs are for next year. Then we can deal with reality and not some imaginary complaint.

Message.Title: Better spin this libs, just more democrap food stamp corruption
Message.Msg: Food stamps are paying for trans-Atlantic takeout â€” with New Yorkers using taxpayer-funded benefits to ship food to relatives in Jamaica, Haiti and the Dominican Republic. Welfare recipients are buying groceries with their Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) cards and packing them in giant barrels for the trip overseas, The Post found. The practice is so common that hundreds of 45- to 55-gallon cardboard and plastic barrels line the walls of supermarkets in almost every Caribbean corner of the city. The feds say the moveable feasts go against the intent of the $86 billion welfare program for impoverished Americans. A spokeswoman for the US Department of Agricultureâ€™s Food and Nutrition Service said welfare benefits are reserved for households that buy and prepare food together. She said states should intervene if people are caught shipping nonperishables abroad. Michael Tanner, a senior fellow at the Cato Institute, called it just another example of welfare abuse. â€œI donâ€™t want food-stamp police to see what people do with their rice and beans, but itâ€™s wrong,â€ Tanner told The Post. â€œThe purpose of this program is to help Americans who donâ€™t have enough to eat. This is not intended as a form of foreign aid.â€ The United States spent $522.7 million on foreign aid to the Caribbean last fiscal year, government data show.

Message.Title: Illegal aliens murder 12 Americans daily
Message.Msg: 09/28/2006 Though no government agency in the U.S. â€“ not the FBI nor Immigration and Customs Enforcement â€“ tracks violent crimes by illegal aliens, even murders of police officers, a search by WND of news reports in the last three years shows law enforcement personnel are hardly immune to deadly carnage wrought by untracked, undocumented armed predators inside the country. While no government agencies specifically track crimes by illegal aliens, there have been some efforts to quantify the loss. Last December, Mac Johnson set out to investigate the number of homicides perpetrated by illegal aliens. Since the federal government would not provide any useful information, he contacted all 50 statehouses. Three months later, he had fewer than a dozen responses. Only one state, Vermont, provided any useful information. He then set out to statistically estimate the number of murders by illegal aliens based on available crime data and conservative estimates of the actually number of illegal aliens in the country â€“ which, of course, nobody really knows. He found that between 1,806 and 2,510 people in the U.S. are murdered annually by illegal aliens. If heâ€™s right, that would represent between 11 percent and 15 percent of all murders in the U.S. In one study of a sample 55,000 illegal immigrants serving prison sentences in the U.S., it was discovered that they are responsible for over 400,000 arrests and over 700,000 felony crimes. According to Heather McDonald of the Manhattan Institute, 95 percent of all outstanding warrants for homicide (which total 1,200 to 1,500) target illegal aliens. Up to two-thirds of all fugitive felony warrants (17,000) are for illegal aliens.
